comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
CWGC has this:

FREEMAN, DOUGLAS STEPHEN

Rank: Lieutenant
Date of Death: 03/05/1915
Age: 39
Regiment/Service: Australian Infantry, A.I.F. 15th Bn.
Panel Reference 33.
Memorial LONE PINE MEMORIAL
Additional Information:
Son of William and Lucy Rose Freeman, of "Clodagh," Beresford Rd., Rose Bay, New South Wales. Native of Marrickville, New South Wales.

comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
First World War Embarkation Roll - Douglas Stephen Freeman

Rank: 2nd Lieutenant
Roll title: 15 Infantry Battalion (December 1914)
Conflict: First World War, 1914-1918
Date of embarkation: 22 December 1914
Place of embarkation: Melbourne
Ship embarked on: HMAT Ceramic
Ship number: A40

The digitised record states that he was a mining manager whose residence was P.O., Bundaberg, Queensland; he was Church of England and his father was his next of kin

comment.author: 92149915@N08
comment._content: SOURCE: alh-research.tripod.com/gallipoli_album/index.album/dougl... Captain Douglas Stephen FREEMAN, a 38 year old Mining manager from Bundaberg, Queensland. He enlisted on 29 September 1914 and was allotted to the 15th Battalion, C Company which embarked from Melbourne, Victoria, on board HMAT A40 Ceramic on 22 December 1914. Subsequently FREEMAN was Killed in Action, 3 May 1915. Sydney Mail, 26 May 1915, p. 8. The photograph is of Captain Douglas Stephen FREEMAN in the uniform of an 4th Australian Infantry Regiment officer and prior to the Great War, was a Lieutenant in this Regiment. In addition FREEMAN was a Second Lieutenant with the 4th Squadron, 3rd Australian Light Horse Regiment from 6 September 1909 until transferring to the 4th Australian Infantry Regiment. See here for an extensive write-up about Douglas including diary entries by himself and others around him at the time of his death.

comment.author: 15161049@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92149915@N08] I followed the hyperlink - it was hard reading that with the image of this man in my head.  An astonishing individual both in peace and war.
